lines.text: My Father's half-dead. My bride has been captured. And you're babbling on about seedlings?
I didn't see the damn thing!
I did sir
[helps Hawkwood]
Bless you Martin, your reward is in heaven.
I'd rather get paid sooner sir if you don't mind.
Why are you so scared? Everything is predestined. Life runs its own course. Look at this little angel! Saint Martin has sent us a little angel to play with!
Come on my soldier. My brave, brave soldier. I'll have you.
[during siege on castle]
Steven, you stay right here with Father George.
Why?
Fighting is for fools.
All we have to do is burn the meat... and our clothes. Take off your clothes. Come on.
Will you show me how it's done? Then I'll know how to go about it.
Right here?
No. Behind the bushes.
I don't feel like doing it right now.
I insist you feel like it right now. You're my maid. You'll do as I say.
What are you doing in this filthy place? Are you looking for something?
I read a book in the convent library, about love and black magic. There was a passage I found fascinating.
What was it about?
A magic root. Mandrake. It grows in a place like this. If a man and a woman eat of it, they will love each other forever.
Did it also say why you have to dig in this particular spot?
The nuns inked out that passage very carefully.
When a man is hanged, he comes and his semen spills to the ground. That's where your mandrake sprouts.
Explains why the passage was inked out.
From now on, we'll eat like this. And whoever can't, best stay the stupid asshole he always was.
Let's see if this angel bleeds!
